text: Living Very Happily () is Cantopop artist Miriam Yeung's () fourteenth Cantonese studio album. It was released by Amusic on 16 October 2009. The album includes eleven new songs. Yeasia – Living Very Happily album info. Retrieved 4 April 2011 The second edition of the album came out on 2 December 2009. The second album includes a DVD with three music videos. Yeasia – Living Very Happily 2nd edition album info. Retrieved 4 April 2011 ==Track listing== # 真命天子 (The Man of Destiny) # 我在橋上看風景 (Standing on a Bridge Looking at the Scenery) # 原來過得很快樂 (Living Very Happily) # 你幸福嗎 (Are You Happy?) # All About Love # 麥芽糖 (Maltose) # 藍風箏 (Blue Kite) # 對木偶唱歌 (Singing to the Puppet) # 孖公仔 (Twins) # 圓缺 (Complete and Incomplete) # All About Love (Little Orchestra Mix) ==DVD== # 真命天子 (The Man of Destiny) MV # 我在橋上看風景 (Standing on a Bridge Looking at the Scenery) MV # 原來過得很快樂 (Living Very Happily) MV ==Awards and Recognitions== {| class="wikitable" !width="270"|Song !width=200|Award !width="30"|Ref |- | rowspan = "3" align="center" | 原來過得很快樂 (Living Very Happily) | Ultimate Song Chart Awards – Ultimate Top 10 Songs | align="center"| |- | Metro Showbiz Hit Awards – Hit Song | |- | RTHK Top 10 Gold Songs Awards Ceremony – Top 10 Songs | |- | align="center" | 真命天子 (Man of Destiny) | Jade Solid Gold Top 10 Awards – Top 10 Songs | align="center"| 2009 Metro Showbiz Hit Awards List Retrieved 29 March 2011. |} ==References== Category:2009 albums Category:Miriam Yeung albums
